tweets.text:
Our Field Team continue to work 24/7 to reduce the risk of #flooding. Last night, our Winsford team were clearing debris screens around #Cheshire in preparation for further forecasted üåßÔ∏è

There is no better time to get yourself #floodaware & #beprepared üëâ https://t.co/CMfTIXUuR8 https://t.co/dhui8Y2fxC

‚ö†Ô∏èWEATHER WARNING‚ö†Ô∏è Flood alert issued by Environment Agency @EnvAgency  - Whinney Brook & Dovers Brook at Maghull, flooding expected for Sefton Lane nr. to Dovers bridge including Waste Transfer Station, Garden Centre & adjacent properties- please be aware and stay safe. https://t.co/6xnEVdS4AR

Brilliant session with @PixmorePE year 5 & 6 as a role model in #STEM with @GCSeasider üåäüèñ

We had a fantastic time discussing #coastal management & we hope you enjoyed the #wave tank demo. Excellent questions too! @STEMAmbassadors #STEMeducation https://t.co/aXTiOYfWoq

An exciting milestone for #Keadby pump station renewal project! 2 of the 6 new pumps have arrived onsite ready for installation. @EnvAgency are continuing to deliver all of our #Flood and Coastal Risk projects where it is safe for our teams and delivery partners to do so. https://t.co/UMiuvzfcMp

There are currently 2 Flood Warnings and 4 Flood Alerts in place for parts of the North West including #Lancashire and #Merseyside. 

Visit https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn for more information. 

Make sure you're signed up to receive free #flood warnings so you can #beprepared.

Great news - culture, heritage and nature are critical to the North's recovery and the well-being of its people.  And the north has all three in spades!!  üé≠üé®üéºüèòÔ∏èüåÑüèõÔ∏èüè∞üå≥üêøÔ∏èüå≤ @HistoricEngland @ace_thenorth @HeritageFundNOR @EnvAgency https://t.co/yEaz7pjwD8

Our next priority for investment is #culture, #leisure and #tourism. 

Recognising that each area faces challenges, the #North will build upon its diverse heritage and natural asssets, level-up the visitor economy and lead a coordinated approach to recovery. #NorthTogether https://t.co/9EyGFgCZGN

Do you have experience in #NFM natural #flood management? If so, we need your help with a project that is looking at making the funding process easier. Tell us more about your experience with NFM funding in this quick survey: https://t.co/N8bYFaKQyn @slowtheflow_UK https://t.co/5ZUTW8Uf9G

tweets.text: Yesterday saw another milestone met in the delivery of @EnvAgencyMids Keadby Pumping Station with the first run of the newly installed Pump 1. Site testing and commissioning will continue over the next two weeks to fine tune and test the pump‚Äôs operation. https://t.co/9wyruoeKBr

The clean-up after Storm Alex is continuing across the North East and Yorkshire. 

The Field Team has been out to clear a large build up debris on the screen on the River Wear at Chester-le-Street.

This ensures the river can flow freely. 

#StormAlex 
#flood 
#Floodaware https://t.co/syL1LKCZTE

You can read more online üëâhttps://t.co/FUci329XTA

Make sure you're following @envagencynw & @TheFloodHub for regular updates on the #Kendal scheme. https://t.co/KiYa1Om7Je

You can watch it here ‚¨áÔ∏è

https://t.co/9xXKAChROW via @YouTube

tweets.text:
As a little contrast everyday water companies leak 2,954,000,000 litres of water from their underinvested, under repaired, faulty, leaky pipes.

Yep that's 1,078,210,000,000 litres of water per year stolen from our rivers.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/RkJP0KAsoX

All traders and businesses have a legal responsibility to dispose their waste. 

If you're a trader or business, you should take your waste to a licensed commercial facility, arrange a collection or hire a skip. 

#dutyofcare #SCRAPflytipping 
@EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/0CdEOHXFEH

tweets.text: These 2 pumps will be able to fill an Olympic swimming pool in approx. 5 minutes! These are the first 2 of 6 pumps to be installed. The remaining 4 pumps will be delivered and installed by year end. Whilst the renewal is underway the existing pumps remain available for duty https://t.co/PPckC5HNAx

Rivers & streams in #Gloucestershire are being closely monitored due to heavy rainfall. @EnvAgency says two flood alerts are currently in place as river levels remain high. More rain is expected later this week.

Picture Credit: @EnvAgency https://t.co/j7MtWUowdw

Augmentation at Ivel Springs is therefore essential, but not at feeble 0.4 ML rate proposed by @AffinityWater - which is less even than the Q90 figure calculated by @EnvAgency. The new borehole must have capacity to augment at 5 ML.
@EnvAgency talk of cost-benefit analysis and say reducing over-abstraction is too expensive. Only a token cap on abstraction at Baldock will be applied.
@EnvAgency  guy: "They're 'Poor' status in the River Basin Management Plan. That's a fact. We can't deny that. The cost of addressing that has been deemed disproportionately too high as it is."
@EnvAgency guy: "We know that all of these ground water bodies for the west of our area (EAnglia) are failing presently to meet their environmental objectives."
@EnvAgency guy: "We know that most of our ground water bodies are over-licensed, over-abstracted."
The @EnvAgency's report into the environmental performance of water companies is released today. You can read the press release, my foreword and the full report here:  https://t.co/mwr4EUcpjm
